item.title: Build Wars 1.1: Release and Dev Diary
item.description:
On April 1st 2019, I released a game called Build Wars. You can play the original game or read the previous developer diary.

This year, I released an updated game, and you're reading the updated developer diary right now.

item.title: Relaunch and Updates
item.description: I finally made time to do some overdue updates. Previously, the site was just a collection of independent projects, with no common layout or site structure. I wanted to integrate them, both technically and visually. And while I was touching everything, I made some upgrades along the way.

item.title: BuildWars: Release and Dev Diary
item.description:
There's a new project, my biggest (and most useless) one yet: Build Wars.

Go play it, then come back to read about its development!

item.title: Release: Account switcher
item.description:
In the patch of January 22nd, 2019, ArenaNet removed the -email and -password command line arguments, making it a bit more tricky to log into multiple accounts.

It will take some time until all the fancy launchers are updated. Meanwhile, I thought I'd share my simple bash script that does the same.

See my Guild Wars 2 Launcher!

Enjoy!

item.title: Release: Mount Adoption Helper
item.description:
When the initial set of mount skins were released, I did some math about the expected costs. Getting exactly the skin(s) you want is surprisingly expensive.

To help players make better purchasing decisions, I decided to write my second project.

item.title: First Project: Dye Browser
item.description:
I'm a paid programmer by day, and an unpaid programmer by night. For my nightly playtime, I'm always looking for interesting projects, to keep my skills sharp. I figured I'd do something useful and write some stuff for the amazing Guild Wars 2 community.

Let's get this train rolling!
